1.text: Draw an oval for the front part of the plane.

2.text: Draw a curve on the left part of the oval for the nose and a semi rectangle for the plane fuselage.

3.text: Draw a triangle for the back part then draw a trapezoid above it for the tail fin.

4.text: Draw a set of semi trapezoids for the wings and stabilizer.

5.text: Draw another small trapezoid for the winglets and small triangles for the funnel connector.

6.text: Draw a set of ovals for the funnels.

7.text: Based on the outline, draw the whole body of the plane.

8.text: Add details such as the windows, doors, wing details and funnel details.

12.text: Draw an inverted version of the first curve you have drawn on top to connect the ends of the curves to produce a rough outline of the airplane’s body.

13.text: Sketch the airplane’s wings on each side using a slanted rectangle.

14.text: Draw a quadrilateral shape on the rear part of the plane to serve as the horizontal and vertical stabilizer.

15.text: Erase unnecessary lines from the outline.

16.text: Draw curved lines beneath the wings for the engine.

17.text: Add details to the plane like windows and doors.

18.text: Color the drawing and add clouds or other planes for details.

20.text: Draw two an arc for the nose and a sharp curve for the back part of the plane.

21.text: Draw a trapezoid at the back part for the tail fin.

22.text: Draw another series of trapezoids for the wings and horizontal stabilizer.

23.text: Draw two cylinders attached to each wing for the funnels.

24.text: Based on the outline, Draw the whole body of the plane.

25.text: Add details such as the windows, doors, wing details and funnel details.

28.text: Draw a big X shape at the center of the paper.

29.text: Using one of the slanted lines as guide, draw a rectangular shape on the lower left side.

30.text: To make it appear three dimensional, reproduce the same shape on the bottom of the original one and connect it with vertical lines.

31.text: Draw the cockpit or flight deck of the airplane using quadrilaterals on top of the plane’s body.

32.text: Draw extended rectangles on each side of the plane for the wings.

33.text: Add the horizontal and vertical stabilizers of the rear part of the plane.

34.text: Draw the landing gear using a circle and connect this to the plane using slanted lines.

35.text: Draw the propeller and spinner on the frontal part of the airplane.

36.text: Erase unnecessary lines and refine details of the drawing.
